DataElement.preferredName: Iodine I 131 First Administered Dose Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A radioactive isotope of iodine with an atomic mass of 131, a half life of eight days, and potential antineoplastic activity. Selectively accumulating in the thyroid gland, iodine I 131 emits beta and gamma particles, thereby killing thyroid cells and decreasing thyroid hormone production._Preceding all others in time or space or degree._Given._The amount of medicine taken, or radiation given, at one time._Text; the words of something written.
